channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish blowing from property into the street, 18th February
item.description:
Number 2 Montague Terrace is an HMO. The tenants do not manage their household waste correctly and it is currently all over the street and in neighbouring properties. There are items such as food waste and used sanitary towels, it stinks and is disgusting. I’ve tried phoning Bromley Council but can’t get through to anyone you will take ownership.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Durham Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous Potholes, 18th February
item.description:
There are several large potholes here. these are dangerous, and are likely damaging car tyres and suspensions. It has already been reported several times. Please fix asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Petersham Drive, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Industrial flytipping, 18th February
item.description:
On the old tennis courts behind Westbury Road and St James Avenue there is flytipping taking place. Old washing machines etc are being left amongst other items. Access to the area is by the opening on Westbury Road by the The Elms building. Please can this be looked into asap/ the area secured so it cannot continue?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vicarage Court, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hydraulic oil pollution, 18th February
item.description:
The oil pollution is a result faulty equipment used by contractors to repair the road on the 16th February
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Grosvenor Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gas cans dumped, 18th February
item.description:
Someone has dumped several cans of nitrous gas, I’m guessing they are empty but the binmen won’t take them, I can’t put them in my waist bin, and they are literally in the road which could cause a hazard to drivers parking or children in the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anthony Road, East Wickham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Column 64 Elmers End Road may also be linked to Columns 1 & 2 of St. Margaret’s Road very near Column 64, 18th February
item.description:
